helpers.name: get_core_tables
helpers.purpose: List all tables in core database
return_statements: Array of table names

helpers.name: get_core_fields
helpers.purpose: Get field names and types for a specific table
return_statements: ```json

helpers.name: get_core_schema
helpers.purpose: Get complete schema for core database (all tables and fields)
return_statements: Object mapping table names to field arrays

helpers.name: get_from_core

parameters.name: id_array
parameters.description: IDs to fetch, **empty array [] returns ALL records**

helpers.purpose: Get records by ID(s), or all records if empty array
helpers.error_handling: Return empty array if no matches
return_statements: Array of records
Empty array allowed for core (read-only, safe to return all)

helpers.name: get_from_core_where

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sort order, e.g., "name ASC" or "id DESC"

helpers.purpose: Flexible filtering with structured JSON conditions
helpers.error_handling: Return empty array if no matches, error if invalid field names
return_statements: Array of matching records

helpers.name: query_core
helpers.purpose: Execute complex SQL WHERE clause (advanced, rare use)
helpers.error_handling: Return error if SQL syntax invalid
return_statements: Array of matching rows
Use Tier 2 (JSON filtering) whenever possible, reserve this for truly complex queries

helpers.name: get_directive_by_name
helpers.purpose: Get specific directive by name (high-frequency operation)
return_statements: Directive object or null
Zero cognitive load - use this instead of constructing queries

helpers.name: get_all_directives
helpers.purpose: Load all directives for caching (special orchestrator)
return_statements: Array of all directives with self-assessment questions
Called once per session for context caching

helpers.name: get_directive_content

parameters.name: directive_name
parameters.description: Name of directive to load MD documentation for

helpers.purpose: Load full MD documentation for directive
helpers.error_handling: Returns error if directive not found or MD file missing
return_statements: Markdown content string
Retrieves comprehensive directive guidance from MD files

used_by_directives.description: AI consults FP directive MD documentation when implementation details unclear. Used for all 65 FP directives (29 core + 36 aux) as reference material.

helpers.name: search_directives

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Keyword to search in directive names, descriptions, and intent_keywords

helpers.purpose: Search directives with filters (orchestrator)
helpers.error_handling: Returns empty array if no matches found
return_statements: Array of matching directives
Higher-level search functionality beyond simple queries

used_by_directives.description: AI searches for relevant FP directives by keyword when uncertain about implementation. Returns list of candidate directives, then AI uses get_directive_content() to load full documentation.
User searches for directives by keyword or topic

helpers.name: find_directive_by_intent

parameters.name: user_request
parameters.description: User's natural language request describing behavior to change

helpers.purpose: Map user intent to directives using NLP/keyword matching
helpers.error_handling: Returns empty array if no matches above threshold
return_statements: Array of matching directives with confidence scores
High-level NLP search that uses AI reasoning to determine intent keywords, then calls `find_directives_by_intent_keyword()` internally

parameters_mapping.user_request: user's preference change request (e.g., 'always add docstrings')

used_by_directives.description: Map user preference request to specific directive name for storing in directive_preferences table. Searches directive name, description, and intent_keywords.

helpers.name: find_directives_by_intent_keyword

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Single keyword string or array of keywords

parameters.name: match_mode
parameters.description: "any" for OR logic, "all" for AND logic

helpers.purpose: Find directive IDs matching one or more intent keywords (direct keyword lookup)
return_statements: Array of directive IDs
Low-level keyword search. For NLP-based intent mapping, use `find_directive_by_intent()`. This is a directive-callable helper (not MCP tool)

helpers.name: get_directives_with_intent_keywords

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Single keyword or array of keywords

parameters.name: match_mode
parameters.description: "any" for OR logic, "all" for AND logic

helpers.purpose: Search directives by intent keywords and return full directive objects
return_statements: Array of directive objects with `matched_keywords` field
Orchestrator that combines keyword search with full directive data retrieval

helpers.name: add_directive_intent_keyword
helpers.purpose: Add an intent keyword to a directive
return_statements: Success boolean
Duplicate keywords for the same directive are prevented by UNIQUE constraint

helpers.name: remove_directive_intent_keyword
helpers.purpose: Remove an intent keyword from a directive
return_statements: Success boolean
Does not delete keyword from intent_keywords table (preserves keyword for reuse)

helpers.name: get_directive_keywords
helpers.purpose: Get all intent keywords for a specific directive
return_statements: Array of keyword strings

helpers.name: get_all_directive_keywords
helpers.purpose: Get list of all unique intent keywords available for searching (simple list)
return_statements: Array of keyword strings, sorted alphabetically
Use this when AI needs to browse available keywords and decide which to search for. For keyword usage statistics, use `get_all_intent_keywords_with_counts()`

helpers.name: get_all_intent_keywords_with_counts
helpers.purpose: Get all unique intent keywords with usage counts for analytics
return_statements: Array of objects with `keyword` and `usage_count` fields, sorted by usage (most used first)
Useful for analytics, identifying popular keywords, and suggesting common searches

`aifp_status()` orchestrator is documented in [helpers-consolidated-orchestrators.md](helpers-consolidated-orchestrators.md#aifp_status) - it's the central status orchestrator that feeds the navigation system below.

helpers.name: get_next_directives_from_status
helpers.purpose: Get all possible next directives with condition evaluation
return_statements: Array of objects:
Returns both matching and non-matching for transparency

helpers.name: get_matching_next_directives
helpers.purpose: Get ONLY directives whose conditions match current state
return_statements: Filtered array with only `matches: true`
Convenience wrapper for most common use case

helpers.name: get_completion_loop_target
helpers.purpose: Get where to loop back after completing directive
return_statements: Single directive name (usually 'aifp_status')
Work directives use this to determine where to return after completion

helpers.name: get_conditional_work_paths
helpers.purpose: Get conditional next steps during work execution
return_statements: Array of conditional work directives with descriptions and priorities
Used when work items have different requirements (file creation, function creation, etc.)

helpers.name: get_helper_by_name
helpers.purpose: Get specific helper function details (high-frequency)
return_statements: Helper object with all metadata
Zero cognitive load for common helper lookups

helpers.name: get_helpers_by_database

helpers.name: get_helpers_not_tool_not_sub
